item.title: Titanic: Machine Learning from Disaster- A Kaggle Competition
Predicting correctness of weight lifting exercises
item.description: Background Many fitness enthusiasts focuse mainly on how often they practice and how heavy they can lift, and usually neglect to verify whether they do it well or not. Yet, injuries due to unnatural movements and overexertion were proved to be the most commonly occuring ones during free weight activities 1. With the increasing use of devices that are equipped with accelerometers it is now possible to quantify how well a movement is done.
